All Implemented Interfaces:
DBProgressListener, IUIConstants, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class UINewDatabaseDialog
extends UIDialog
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, IUIConstants, DBProgressListener

UINewDatabaseDialog defines the dialog to allow a user to create a new database

Author:
Michelle Bachler

Constructor Detail

UINewDatabaseDialog

public UINewDatabaseDialog(javax.swing.JFrame parent,
                           java.util.Vector projects,
                           java.lang.String sMySQLName,
                           java.lang.String sMySQLPassword,
                           java.lang.String sMySQLIP)
Initialises and sets up the dialog.

Parameters:
parent - the parent frame for this dialog.
projects - a list of the current database project names.
sMySQLName - the username to use when connecting to MySQL to create the new database.
sMySQLPassword - the password to use when connecting to MySQL to create the new database.
sMySQLIP - the ip address or hostname to use when connecting to the database to create the new project.

loadDefaultData

private boolean loadDefaultData(java.lang.String sHomeViewID)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Load the default data if any is specified in the System.ini file.

Parameters:
sHomeViewID - the id of the home view to load the data into.
Returns:
true if completely successful.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an IO or Zip error.
